description: The PV2 segment is a continuation of information contained on the PV1 segment.

fields.name: Prior Pending Location
fields.description: This field is required for cancel pending transfer (A26) messages.  In all other events it is optional.

fields.name: Point Of Care
fields.description: This component specifies the code for the point where patient care is administered. It is conditional on PL.6 Person Location Type (e.g., nursing unit or department or clinic). After floor, it is the most general patient location designation. Refer to User-defined Table 0302 - Point of care for suggested values.

fields.name: Room
fields.description: This component specifies the code for the patient's room. After point of care, it is the most general person location designation. Refer to User-defined Table 0303 - Room for suggested values.

fields.name: Bed
fields.description: This component specifies the code for the patient's bed. After room, it is the most general person location designation. Refer to User-defined Table 0304 - Bed for suggested values.

fields.name: Facility
fields.description: This component is subject to site interpretation but generally describes the highest level physical designation of an institution, medical center or enterprise. It is the most general person location designation.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID> (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 Table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Location Status
fields.description: This component specifies the code for the status or availability of the location. For example, it may convey bed status. Refer to User-defined Table 0306 - Location status for suggested values.

fields.name: Person Location Type
fields.description: Person location type is the categorization of the persons location defined by facility, building, floor, point of care, room or bed. Although not a required field, when used, it may be the only populated field. It usually includes values such as nursing unit, department, clinic, SNF, physicians office. Refer to User-defined Table 0305 - Person location type for suggested values.

fields.name: Building
fields.description: This component specifies the code for the building where the person is located. After facility, it is the most general person location designation. Refer to User-defined Table 0307 - Building for suggested values.

fields.name: Floor
fields.description: This component specifies the code for the floor where the person is located. After building, it is the most general person location designation. Refer to User-defined Table 0308 - Floor for suggested values.

fields.name: Location Description
fields.description: This component describes the location in free text.

fields.name: Comprehensive Location Identifier
fields.description: The unique identifier that represents the physical location as a whole without regard for the individual components. This accommodates sites that may have a different method of defining physical units or who may code at a less granular level. For example, point of care, room, and bed may be 1 indivisible code.

fields.name: Entity Identifier
fields.description: The first component, <entity identifier>, is usually defined to be unique within the series of identifiers created by the <assigning authority>, defined by a hierarchic designator, represented by components 2 through 4. See Section 2.A.33, "HD - hierarchic designator".

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. Refer to User-defined Table 0363 - Assigning authority for suggested values.

fields.name: Assigning Authority For Location
fields.description: The entity that creates the data for the individual physical location components. If populated, it should be the authority for all components populated. Refer to User-defined Table 0363 - Assigning authority for suggested values for the first sub-component of the HD component, <namespace ID>.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID> (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 Table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Accommodation Code
fields.description: This field indicates the specific patient accommodations for this visit. Refer to User-defined Table 0129 - Accommodation Code for suggested values.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component.

fields.name: Admit Reason
fields.description: This field contains the short description of the reason for patient admission.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component.

fields.name: Transfer Reason
fields.description: This field contains the short description of the reason for a patient location change.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component.

fields.name: Patient Valuables
fields.description: This field contains the short description of patient valuables checked in during admission.

fields.name: Patient Valuables Location
fields.description: This field indicates the location of the patients valuables.

fields.name: Visit User Code
fields.description: This field further categorizes a patients visit with respect to an individual institutions needs, and is expected to be site-specific. Refer to User-defined Table 0130 - Visit User Code for suggested values.

fields.name: Expected Admit Date/Time
fields.description: This field contains the date and time that the patient is expected to be admitted. This field is also used to reflect the date/time of an outpatient/emergency patient registration.

fields.name: Time
fields.description: The point in time.

fields.name: Degree Of Precision
fields.description:
Retained only for purposes of backward compatibility as of v 2.3. Refer to component 1 for current method of designating degree of precision.

Indicates the degree of precision of the time stamp (Y = year, L = month, D = day, H = hour, M = minute, S = second). Refer to HL7 Table 0529 - Precision for valid value.

fields.name: Expected Discharge Date/Time
fields.description: This field contains the date and time that the patient is expected to be discharged. This is a non-event related date used by ancillaries to determine more accurately the projected workloads. This field is also used to reflect the anticipated discharge date/time of an outpatient/emergency patient, or an inpatient.

fields.name: Time
fields.description: The point in time.

fields.name: Degree Of Precision
fields.description:
Retained only for purposes of backward compatibility as of v 2.3. Refer to component 1 for current method of designating degree of precision.

Indicates the degree of precision of the time stamp (Y = year, L = month, D = day, H = hour, M = minute, S = second). Refer to HL7 Table 0529 - Precision for valid value.

fields.name: Estimated Length of Inpatient Stay
fields.description: This field specifies the estimated days of inpatient stays.

fields.name: Actual Length of Inpatient Stay
fields.description: This field contains the actual days of inpatient stays. The actual length of the inpatient stay may not be calculated from the admission and discharge dates because of possible leaves of absence.

fields.name: Visit Description
fields.description: This field contains a brief user-defined description of the visit.

fields.name: Referral Source Code
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID Number and Name for Persons
fields.description: This field contains the name and the identification numbers of the person or organization that made the referral. This person/organization is not the same as the referring doctor. For example, Joe Smith referred me to the Clinic (or to Dr. Jones at the Clinic).

fields.name: Id Number
fields.description: This string refers to the coded ID according to a user-defined table, defined by the 9th component. If the first component is present, either the source table or the assigning authority must be valued.

fields.name: Family Name
fields.description: This component allows full specification of the surname of a person. Where appropriate, it differentiates the person's own surname from that of the person's partner or spouse, in cases where the person's name may contain elements from either name. It also permits messages to distinguish the surname prefix (such as "van" or "de") from the surname root. See section 2.A.30, " FN - family name".

fields.name: Surname
fields.description: The atomic element of the person's family name. In most Western usage, this is the person's last name.

fields.name: Own Surname Prefix
fields.description: Internationalization usage for Germanic languages. This component is optional. An example of a <surname prefix> is the "van" in "Ludwig van Beethoven". Since the <surname prefix> doesn't sort completely alphabetically, it is reasonable to specify it as a separate sub-component of the PN and extended PN data types (XPN and XCN).

fields.name: Own Surname
fields.description: The portion of the surname (in most Western usage, the last name) that is derived from the person's own surname, as distinguished from any portion that is derived from the surname of the person's partner or spouse. This component is optional.

fields.name: Surname Prefix From Partner/Spouse
fields.description: Internationalization usage for Germanic languages. This component is optional. An example of a <surname prefix> is the van in "Ludwig van Beethoven". Since the <surname prefix> doesn't sort completely alphabetically, it is reasonable to specify it as a separate sub-component of the PN and extended PN data types (XPN and XCN).

fields.name: Surname From Partner/Spouse
fields.description: The portion of the person's surname (in most Western usage, the last name) that is derived from the surname of the person's partner or spouse, as distinguished from the part derived from the person's own surname. This component is optional.

fields.name: Given Name
fields.description: First name.

fields.name: Second And Further Given Names Or Initials Thereof
fields.description: Multiple middle names may be included by separating them with spaces.

fields.name: Suffix (e.g., Jr Or Iii)
fields.description: Used to specify a name suffix (e.g., Jr. or III).

fields.name: Prefix (e.g., Dr)
fields.description: Used to specify a name prefix (e.g., Dr.).

fields.name: Degree (e.g., Md)
fields.description: Retained for backward compatibility only as of v 2.5. See Professional Suffix component.

fields.name: Source Table
fields.description: CN ID source is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component. Used to delineate the first component.

fields.name: Assigning Authority
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency of department) that creates the data. User-defined Table 0363 - Assigning authority is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for the first sub-component of the HD component, <namespace ID>.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID> (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 Table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Name Type Code
fields.description: A code that represents the type of name. Refer to HL7 Table 0200 - Name type for valid values. See Section 2.A.88.7, " Name Type Code (ID) ".

fields.name: Identifier Check Digit
fields.description: The check digit in this data type is not an add-on produced by the message processor. It is the check digit that is part of the identifying number used in the sending application. If the sending application does not include a self-generated check digit in the identifying number, this component should be valued null.

fields.name: Check Digit Scheme
fields.description: Contains the code identifying the check digit scheme employed.

fields.name: Identifier Type Code
fields.description: A code corresponding to the type of identifier. In some cases, this code may be used as a qualifier to the <assigning authority> component. Refer to HL7 Table 0203 - Identifier type for suggested values.

fields.name: Assigning Facility
fields.description: The place or location identifier where the identifier was first assigned to the person. This component is not an inherent part of the identifier but rather part of the history of the identifier: as part of this data type, its existence is a convenience for certain intercommunicating systems.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID> (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 Table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Name Representation Code
fields.description: Different <name/address types> and representations of the same <name/address> should be described by repeating of this field, with different values of the <name/address type> and/or <name/address representation> component.

fields.name: Name Context
fields.description: This component is used to designate the context in which a name is used. The main use case is in Australian healthcare for indigenous patients who prefer to use different names when attending different healthcare institutions. Another use case occurs in the US where health practitioners can be licensed under slightly different names and the reporting of the correct name is vital for administrative purposes. Refer to User-defined Table 0448 - Name context for suggested values.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component.

fields.name: Name Validity Range
fields.description:
Retained for backward compatibility only as of v 2.5. Refer to XCN.19 Effective Date and XCN.20 Expiration Date instead. This component cannot be fully expressed and has been identified as v 2.4 erratum.

This component contains the start and end date/times that define the period during which this name was valid. See section 2.A.20, " DR - date/time range " for description of subcomponents.

fields.name: Range Start Date/Time
fields.description: The first component contains the earliest date/time (time stamp) in the specified range.

fields.name: Time
fields.description: The point in time.

fields.name: Degree Of Precision
fields.description:
Retained only for purposes of backward compatibility as of v 2.3. Refer to component 1 for current method of designating degree of precision.

Indicates the degree of precision of the time stamp (Y = year, L = month, D = day, H = hour, M = minute, S = second). Refer to HL7 Table 0529 - Precision for valid value.

fields.name: Range End Date/Time
fields.description: The second component contains the latest date/time in the specified range. Note that the TS (time stamp) data type allows the specification of precision.

fields.name: Time
fields.description: The point in time.

fields.name: Degree Of Precision
fields.description:
Retained only for purposes of backward compatibility as of v 2.3. Refer to component 1 for current method of designating degree of precision.

Indicates the degree of precision of the time stamp (Y = year, L = month, D = day, H = hour, M = minute, S = second). Refer to HL7 Table 0529 - Precision for valid value.

fields.name: Name Assembly Order
fields.description: A code that represents the preferred display order of the components of this person name. Refer to HL7 Table 0444 - Name Assembly Order for valid values.

fields.name: Effective Date
fields.description: The first date, if known, on which the address is valid and active.

fields.name: Time
fields.description: The point in time.

fields.name: Degree Of Precision
fields.description:
Retained only for purposes of backward compatibility as of v 2.3. Refer to component 1 for current method of designating degree of precision.

Indicates the degree of precision of the time stamp (Y = year, L = month, D = day, H = hour, M = minute, S = second). Refer to HL7 Table 0529 - Precision for valid value.

fields.name: Expiration Date
fields.description: The last date, if known, on which the address is valid and active.

fields.name: Time
fields.description: The point in time.

fields.name: Degree Of Precision
fields.description:
Retained only for purposes of backward compatibility as of v 2.3. Refer to component 1 for current method of designating degree of precision.

Indicates the degree of precision of the time stamp (Y = year, L = month, D = day, H = hour, M = minute, S = second). Refer to HL7 Table 0529 - Precision for valid value.

fields.name: Professional Suffix
fields.description: Used to specify an abbreviation, or a string of abbreviations denoting qualifications that support the persons profession, (e.g., licenses, certificates, degrees, affiliations with professional societies, etc.). The Professional Suffix normally follows the Family Name when the Person Name is used for display purposes. Please note that this component is an unformatted string and is used for display purposes only. Detailed information regarding the contents of Professional Suffix is obtained using appropriate segments in Chapter 15, Personnel Management.

fields.name: Assigning Jurisdiction
fields.description: The geo-political body that assigned the identifier in component 1.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Analogous to "Identifier" in component 1. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. Analogous to "Text" in component 2. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component. Analogous to Name of Coding System above. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This is the version ID for the coding system identified by components 1-3. It belongs conceptually to the group of component 1-3 and appears here only for reasons of backward compatibility.

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This is the version ID for the coding system identified by components 4-6. It belongs conceptually to the group of alternate components (See usage note in section introduction) and appears here only for reasons of backward compatibility.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Assigning Agency Or Department
fields.description: The agency or department that assigned the identifier in component 1.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Analogous to "Identifier" in component 1. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. Analogous to "Text" in component 2. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component. Analogous to Name of Coding System above. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This is the version ID for the coding system identified by components 1-3. It belongs conceptually to the group of component 1-3 and appears here only for reasons of backward compatibility.

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This is the version ID for the coding system identified by components 4-6. It belongs conceptually to the group of alternate components (See usage note in section introduction) and appears here only for reasons of backward compatibility.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Previous Service Date
fields.description: This field contains the date of previous service for the same recurring condition. This may be a required field for billing certain illnesses (e.g., accident related) to a third party.

fields.name: Employment Illness Related Indicator
fields.description: This field specifies whether a patients illness was job-related. Refer to HL7 Table 0136 - Yes/no Indicator for valid values.

fields.name: Purge Status Code
fields.description: This field contains the purge status code for the account. It is used by the application program to determine purge processing. Refer to User-defined Table 0213 - Purge Status Code for suggested values.

fields.name: Purge Status Date
fields.description: This field contains the date on which the data will be purged from the system.

fields.name: Special Program Code
fields.description: This field designates the specific health insurance program for a visit required for healthcare reimbursement. Refer to User-defined Table 0214 - Special Program Codes for suggested values.

fields.name: Retention Indicator
fields.description: This field allows the user to control the financial and demographic purge processes at the visit. It is used to preserve demographic and financial data on specific, high priority visits. Refer to HL7 Table 0136 - Yes/no Indicator for valid values.

fields.name: Expected Number of Insurance Plans
fields.description: This field contains the number of insurance plans that may provide coverage for this visit.

fields.name: Visit Publicity Code
fields.description: This field contains a user-defined code indicating what level of publicity is allowed for a specific visit. Refer to User-defined Table 0215 - Publicity Code for suggested values. Refer to PD1-11 - Publicity Code for the patient level publicity code.

fields.name: Visit Protection Indicator
fields.description: This field identifies the persons protection that determines, in turn, whether access to information about this person should be kept from users who do not have adequate authority for a specific visit. Refer to HL7 Table 0136 - Yes/no Indicator for valid values.

fields.name: Clinic Organization Name
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite Name and Identification Number for Organizations
fields.description: This field contains the organization name or sub-unit and identifier that is associated with the (visit) episode of care. For example, the Allergy or Oncology Clinic within the healthcare facility might be named.

fields.name: Organization Name
fields.description: The name of the specified organization.

fields.name: Organization Name Type Code
fields.description: A code that represents the type of name i.e., legal name, display name. Refer to User-defined Table 0204 - Organizational Name Type for suggested values.

fields.name: Id Number
fields.description: This component has been retained for backward compatibility only as of v 2.5. It is recommended to use component 10 Organization identifier that accommodates alphanumeric identifiers.

fields.name: Check Digit
fields.description: The check digit in this data type is not an add-on produced by the message processor. It is the check digit that is part of the identifying number used in the sending application. If the sending application does not include a self-generated check digit in the identifying number, this component should be valued null.

fields.name: Check Digit Scheme
fields.description: Contains the code identifying the check digit scheme employed.

fields.name: Assigning Authority
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. Assigning authorities are unique across a given HL7 implementation. Refer to User-defined Table 0363 - Assigning Authority for suggested values.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID> (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 Table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Identifier Type Code
fields.description: A code corresponding to the type of identifier. In some cases, this code may be used as a qualifier to the "Assigning authority" component. Refer to HL7 Table 0203 - Identifier type for suggested values.

fields.name: Assigning Facility
fields.description: The place or location identifier where the identifier was first assigned to the person. This component is not an inherent part of the identifier but rather part of the history of the identifier: as part of this data type, its existence is a convenience for certain intercommunicating systems.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID> (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 Table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Name Representation Code
fields.description: Different <name/address types> and representations of the same <name/address> should be described by repeating of this field, with different values of the <name/address type> and/or <name/address representation> component.

fields.name: Organization Identifier
fields.description: This component contains the sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by XON.1 Organization Name. This component replaces XON.3 ID Number as of v 2.5.

fields.name: Patient Status Code
fields.description: This field indicates the status of the episode of care. Refer to User-defined Table 0216 - Patient Status for suggested values.

fields.name: Visit Priority Code
fields.description: This field contains the priority of the visit. Refer to User-defined Table 0217 - Visit Priority Code for suggested values.

fields.name: Previous Treatment Date
fields.description: This field contains the date that the patient last had treatment for any condition prior to this visit. In the case of a prior hospital visit, it is likely to be the previous discharge date.

fields.name: Expected Discharge Disposition
fields.description: This field describes what the patients disposition is expected to be at the end of the visit. Refer to User-defined Table 0112 - Discharge Disposition for suggested values.

fields.name: Signature on File Date
fields.description: This field contains the date on which a signature was obtained for insurance billing purposes.

fields.name: First Similar Illness Date
fields.description: This field is used to determine if the patient has a pre-existing condition.

fields.name: Patient Charge Adjustment Code
fields.description: This field contains a user-defined code that indicates which adjustments should be made to this patients charges. Refer to User-defined Table 0218 - Charge Adjustment for suggested values. This field is the same as GT1-26 - Guarantor Charge Adjustment Code.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component.

fields.name: Recurring Service Code
fields.description: This field indicates whether the treatment is continuous. Refer to User-defined Table 0219 - Recurring Service for suggested values.

fields.name: Billing Media Code
fields.description: This field indicates if the account is to be rejected from tape billing. Refer to HL7 Table 0136 - Yes/no Indicator for valid values.

fields.name: Expected Surgery Date and Time
fields.description: This field contains the date and time on which the surgery is expected to occur.

fields.name: Time
fields.description: The point in time.

fields.name: Degree Of Precision
fields.description:
Retained only for purposes of backward compatibility as of v 2.3. Refer to component 1 for current method of designating degree of precision.

Indicates the degree of precision of the time stamp (Y = year, L = month, D = day, H = hour, M = minute, S = second). Refer to HL7 Table 0529 - Precision for valid value.

fields.name: Military Partnership Code
fields.description: This field indicates that a military healthcare facility has contracted with a non-military healthcare facility for the use of its services. Refer to HL7 Table 0136 - Yes/no Indicator for valid values.

fields.name: Military Non-Availability Code
fields.description: This field indicates whether a patient has permission to use a non-military healthcare facility for treatment. Refer to HL7 Table 0136 - Yes/no Indicator for valid values.

fields.name: Newborn Baby Indicator
fields.description: This field indicates whether the patient is a baby. Refer to HL7 Table 0136 - Yes/no Indicator for valid values.

fields.name: Baby Detained Indicator
fields.description: This field indicates if the baby is detained after the mothers discharge. Refer to HL7 Table 0136 - Yes/no Indicator for valid values.

fields.name: Mode of Arrival Code
fields.description: Identifies how the patient was brought to the healthcare facility. Refer to User-defined Table 0430 - Mode of Arrival Code for suggested values.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component.

fields.name: Recreational Drug Use Code
fields.description: This field indicates what recreational drugs the patient uses. It is used for the purpose of room assignment. Refer to User-defined Table 0431 - Recreational Drug Use Code for suggested values.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text

fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component.

fields.name: Admission Level of Care Code
fields.description: This field indicates the acuity level assigned to the patient at the time of admission. Refer to User-defined Table 0432 - Admission Level of Care Code for suggested values.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component.

fields.name: Precaution Code
fields.description: This field indicates non-clinical precautions that need to be taken with the patient. Refer to User-defined Table 0433 - Precaution Code for suggested values.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component.

fields.name: Patient Condition Code
fields.description: This field indicates the patients current medical condition for the purpose of communicating to non-medical outside parties, e.g. family, employer, religious minister, media, etc. Refer to User-defined Table 0434 - Patient Condition Code for suggested values.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component.

fields.name: Living Will Code
fields.description: This field indicates whether or not the patient has a living will and, if so, whether a copy of the living will is on file at the healthcare facility. If the patient does not have a living will, the value of this field indicates whether the patient was provided information on living wills. Refer to User-defined Table 0315 - Living Will Code for suggested values. See also PD1-7 - Living Will.

fields.name: Organ Donor Code
fields.description: This field indicate whether the patient wants to donate his/her organs and whether an organ donor card or similar documentation is on file with the healthcare organization. Refer to User-defined Table 0316 - Organ Donor Code for suggested values. See also PD1-8 - Organ Donor.

fields.name: Advance Directive Code
fields.description: This field indicates the patients instructions to the healthcare facility. Refer to User-defined Table 0435 - Advance Directive Code for suggested values. See also PD1-15 - Advance Directive Code.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component.

fields.name: Patient Status Effective Date
fields.description: This field indicates the effective date for PV2-24 - Patient Status.

fields.name: Expected LOA Return Date/Time
fields.description: This field is conditionally required for A21 - Patient goes on LOA. It may be populated in A22 - Patient returns from LOA as well as in the A53 - Cancel LOA for a patient and the A54 - Cancel patient returns from LOA triggers. This field contains the date/time that the patient is expected to return from LOA.

fields.name: Time
fields.description: The point in time.

fields.name: Degree Of Precision
fields.description:
Retained only for purposes of backward compatibility as of v 2.3. Refer to component 1 for current method of designating degree of precision.

Indicates the degree of precision of the time stamp (Y = year, L = month, D = day, H = hour, M = minute, S = second). Refer to HL7 Table 0529 - Precision for valid value.

fields.name: Expected Pre-admission Testing Date/Time
fields.description: This field contains the date/time that the patient is expected for pre-admission testing.

fields.name: Time
fields.description: The point in time.

fields.name: Degree Of Precision
fields.description:
Retained only for purposes of backward compatibility as of v 2.3. Refer to component 1 for current method of designating degree of precision.

Indicates the degree of precision of the time stamp (Y = year, L = month, D = day, H = hour, M = minute, S = second). Refer to HL7 Table 0529 - Precision for valid value.

fields.name: Notify Clergy Code
fields.description: This field allows the user to indicate whether the clergy should be notified. Refer to User-defined Table 0534 - Notify Clergy Code for suggested values.
